section.name: Using Simple-JNDI for Configuration
section.p: JNDI is a natural location for configuration information for applications, and Simple-JNDI is a good fit for such configuration. Rather than using the JNDI API directly, GenJava Config is a nice facade to place on top.
Alternatively, Commons Configuration can sit on top of JNDI and should work with Simple-JNDI (we'd love to know if anybody does this).
